lines.text: For years I've thought about killing myself. It's the only thing that kept me going.
I stole that money.
Okay.
From drug dealers.
ARE YOU NUTS?
Hey calm down! Take it easy! Scott just give it back to them.
I spent it.
YOU SPENT IT? HE SPENT MONEY FROM DRUG DEALERS!
Calm down, take it easy. Scott, you can't run from these guys. They'll find you. They'll come to your house, take all your money and then beat the shit out of you. Happened to me a few times.
You're a tragic hero. You're Lou Gehrig.
Who?
Lou Gehrig. Everybody knows Lou Gehrig. The baseball player. He died of Lou Gehrig's Disease.
Wow, what are the odds on that?
How did you get her husband to talk?
I head-butted him.
How Joe Pesci of you. What are gonna do with her, run her tits through the Visa machine?
Jack, look at this.
It's money. I remember it from when I was single.
Well, Scotty, you're boring. I liked you for a while, but now I can't stand looking at you. Even your voice makes me sick.
That was lovely.
Yes, Hallmark is waiting for you.
Where do you like to stay?
My house, but it's in Los Angeles.
What happened?
He poured hot coffee all over my penis. Took my clothes and he ran away.
Don't cry! Now where is he?
I don't know.
I don't like you.
Do you have a boyfriend?
No!
Good! Me neither!
This kid is a major pain in the ass, he's so damn annoying.
You don't like anything that's annoying.
Who does?

[serious]
No, I mean that's a special thing for you.
Do you know who I am? I am the cowboy with the Village People, Bob, if I don't get back there, it's just gonna be "Y-M-_-A!"
[Dale, Jack and Scott are at jail. Jack is paying the fines]

This is for my fine. This is for his fine. This is for the boy's fine. This is for getting the car out of the impound, and this is for the fabulous breakfast buffet we had this morning. Are eggs supposed to make noise when you eat them?
Very funny. Look, just stay out of trouble.
See you next year at the reunion.
Why are you doing this?
We're your fathers.
How about crying again? You know, it might reach her maternal... thing.
Cry? Just like that?
You cried when we missed the exit!
Don't mock me.
"Hello Mr. Colon, my prostate's feelin' swollen. I think that things are flowin' not so well."
[Knock on the door]
Breakfast! "I'm feelin' kinda heinous cause there's something in my..."
Morning!
[In Dale's car driving slowly over the Golden Gate Bridge]
Dale, I feel like I'm in a white Bronco.
Sorry, I just get anxious driving over bridges.
That's because you're going 20 miles per hour.
I'm going 35 miles per hour, Jack!
Yeah, I can feel the G-force.
I'm an actor. A writer at large. I produce plays, things from my soul. But it's avant-garde, very experimental.
You mean with guinea pigs?
You know what? Take my car.
You're giving me your car, Jack? That's so Elvis of you.
Not to keep. To take the airport. I'll have one of my interns pick it up in the morning.
You want me driving your car?
It's just a thing. It's a priceless, irreplaceable thing.
I feel like such a loser.
Come on, Scott, you're still young! Being a true loser takes years of ineptitude.

[Screeches to a halt all of a sudden]
Could you see if there's someone lying in the road?

[Looks back]
No, nothing there.
There's not a body lying in the road?
A what?
A body.

[Gets out of the car and looks all around. The car had stopped on a country road in the middle of nowhere]
No, nobody there.
I often think that I've run someone over.
Gentlemen, haven't we learned anything from the music of John Lennon? All we need is love.
No, all we need is money, mate.

[Rehearsing his introduction to Scott]
You know, Scott, when I was your age I was pulling on myself harder than a tractor pulling Arkansas.
The money is safe. It's in a safe! It's at the hotel where I'm staying. I'll go get it.

Um, do I have 'asshole' tattooed on my forehead for something? I think we all better go get it, eh? Now Scott, you're not bullshitting us are you? Because if you're bullshitting us, I'm gonna kill you.
He was lying to me, but he made me feel good.
What do you mean he lied to you?
Lied right to my face. Big-time lie.
How do you know?
I'm a lawyer. People lie to me all the time.
How long have you been driving?
About 30 years now.
Oh? Listen these things take time. Brake! Brake!
[the front tires run right over the parking block]
Perfect.
[Trying out different ways to greet his son]

[as a hippie]
Dude, I'm your old man. I suppose you're wondering why your middle name is Rainbow.
[as a thug]
Yo son, what's up, homes?
[as a New Age adept]
I am your father. Hug me, and let us join our spirits.
$5,000 in cash. What is he doing with $5,000 in cash?
He stole it.
Why do you always jump to the worst possible conclusion?
Okay, he won it in a hair-whirl contest.
What do you do for a living?
Uh, I teach English as a third language at the Jewish Community Center.

[singing]
"Gray skies are gonna clear up, sit on a happy..."
Come on Jack
Whoa, where are you going?
Kick some ass
